questions.text: True about bacterial cell division is
questions.solution:
Bacteria divide by binary fission. Depending on the plane of division, Bacterial cells do not necessary break apart

questions.solution:
Limit of resolution of light Microscope is 300 nm

choices.text: Cell wall of gram positive bacteria
Cell membrane of gram positive bacteria
Cell wall of gram negative bacteria
Outer membrane of gram negative bacteria

questions.text: Porins present in
questions.solution:
Outer membranes which are present only in gram negative bacteria, function as the cells initial barrier to the environment .

Scattered throughout The lippopolysaccharide macromoleucles are protein structure called porins. These control the passage of nutrients and other solute including antibiotics, through outer membrane.

Reference: bailey and scott diagnostic microbiology page 19

Hot air over is used for Glassware, swabs, liquid paraffin, fat and grease, all glass syringes, forceps, scissor, scalpel, dusting powder

questions.text: Large granular cells belongs to
questions.solution:
When circulating lymphocytes are classified by their surface marker into T and B cells about 5-10 percent of cells are found to lack featu;res of either type they are called null cell/Large granular lympocytes .

questions.text: Which of the following cells does not have cytotoxic activity ?
questions.solution:
Cytotoxicity of different cell


Reference: Essential of microbiology p 786

choices.text: Induce enzyme synthesis in the target cells

questions.text: What is true about interferon ?
questions.solution:
IFN are species specific ( not virus specific)

IFNs are divided into three subtypes, IFN are also produced in response of bacteria, parasite and tumor cell

In response to interferon, cells produce a large amount of an enzyme known as protein kinase R. This enzyme phosphorylates a protein known as eIF 2 in response to new viral infections. The phosphorylated Eif 2 forms an inactive complex with another protein called eif2b, to reduce protein synthesis within the cell.

Reference: principle of modern microbiology P 389

questions.text: MHC class II is coded in which region
questions.solution:
MHC class I comprises - A, B and C loci

MHC class II comprises - D region ( DR, DQ, DP)

MHC class III comprises C2 and C4 properdin factor B, heat shock protein, TNF alpha and B

Reference: Ananthanarayan 9th 140

questions.text: Antibody diversity is due to ?
questions.solution: Reference: ananthanarayan 9 th 95

questions.text: Maximum half life
questions.solution:
Ig G has maximum half life

questions.solution:
Superantigen bind directly to the lateral portion of TCR B chain and MHC Class II B chain

questions.text: Most common biotype of S aureus causing human infection
questions.solution:
Most human pathogenic strains belong to biotype A

questions.text: Following test is helpful in identification of which organism
questions.solution:
It is a Bacitracin sensitivity test. There is zone of inhibiton around the disc

questions.text: Post splenectomy patients are in need of which vaccine ?
questions.solution:
The most serious consequence of splenectomy is increased susceptibility to bacterial infections, Particularly those with capsule such as

  1. Streptococcal pneumonia
  2. H influenza
  3. Gram negative enteric organism

Splenectomized patients are also more susceptible to parasitid disease Babesiosis

There is no increased risk of viral infection after splenectomy.

choices.text: Differentiation of group B streptococci from other streptococci

questions.text: Bile solubility is used for
questions.solution:
Pneumococcus is bile soluble while streptococcus in insoluble

Reference: Ananthanarayan 8th 219

questions.text: Differentiating feature of Neisseria gonococcus form Neisseria meningitidis is?
questions.solution: Reference: ananthnarayan 9th 232,277

questions.text: Diphtheria toxin acts by
questions.solution:
The diphtheria toxin acts by inhibiting protein synthesis. It inhibits polypeptide chain elongation in the presence of nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide by inactivating elongation factor EF 2

Reference: Ananthnarayan 9th 238

choices.text: Toluidine blue, malachite green, glacial acetic
Carbol fuchsin, acid alcohol and methylene blue

questions.text: Which stain stain bacteria shown in this image
questions.solution:
Toluidine blue and malachite green both of which are basic dyes with high affinity for acidic tissue components like cytoplasm

Mlachite green stains the cytoplasm blue green

questions.text: Cutaneous anthrax is caused by
questions.solution:
Cutaneous anthrax was common in butcher and dealer of hides

The disease used to be common in dock workers carrying loads of hides and sking on their back therefore it is also know as hide porter's disease.

questions.text: Botulinum toxin acts on
questions.solution:
Botulinum neurotoxin whether ingested inhaled or produced in the intestine or wound, enters the vascular system and is transported to peripheral cholinergic nerve terminals, including neuromuscular junctions. Postganglionic parasympathetic nerve ending and peripheral ganglia. The central nervous system is not involved.

Reference: Ananthanarayan 9th 264

questions.text: In which type of cutaneous tuberculosis caseation is most commonly seen
questions.solution:
Lupus vulgaris is the ost common variant of cutaneous tuberculosis and is characterised by caseating granulomatous lesion

Cutaneous manifestation of TB are

  1. Lupus vulgaris ( 55 %) most common
  2. Scrufuloderma ( 27 %) 2nd most common
  3. Tuberculids ( 7%)
  4. TB verrucosacutis ( 6%)
  5. Tubercular gumma ( 5%)

Reference: Microbiology and immunology pariza 1st 455

questions.text: Positive tuberculin test means
questions.solution:
Positive test indicated hypersensitivity ( Delayed Hypersensitivity) to tuberculoprotein, which may be due to active infection, subclinical infection, past infection and BCG vaccination.

questions.text: Coxsackie A virus mainly causes
questions.solution:
Among the given options, Coxsackie A virus causes aseptic meningitis more frequently.

A (H1N1), A ( H3N2) and B

A new type has been recognized A ( H5N1)

questions.solution:

questions.solution:

questions.text: A patient made a self diagnosis of athlete's foot ( Tinea pedis) and began using a product advertised on television. The condition improved but did not clear and then patient showed himself to a dermatologist. A skin scrapping was sent to the laboratory for culture including culture for fungi. The fungal culture yielded a slow growing colony, which produced a few small microconidia. This is consistent with isolation of a dermatophyte of a genera
questions.solution:
Dermatophytes can be identified by their colonial appearance and microscopic morphology after growth for 2 weeks at 25 degree celcius on SDA.

Differential diagnosis of dermatophytes on the basis of Macroconidia and microconidia


Reference: Ananthanarayan 8th 603

questions.text: A vitreous aspirate from a case of metastatic endophthalmitis on culture yield gram positive rond to oval cells, 12-14 micron in size, the aspirate on gram stain show the presence of psudohyphae. Which of the following is the most likely aetiological agent ?
questions.solution:
The important clue in this question are

  1. the organism form psudophphae
  2. The organism is gram positive

Amongst the given options only candida form psuedohyphae. All other options ( Aspergillus, Rhizopus and Fusarium) are filamentous fungi forming true mycelia ( not pseudohyphae).

Candida yeast cells and pseudohyphae are the only fungi that are usually gram positive on smears.

Reference: Anathnarayan 8th 607

choices.text: Increase chances of inf if CD4 T Cell les than 200
Prophylaxis should be started if CD4 T cell less than 200
Cotrimoxazole is the drug of choice

questions.text: True about pneumocystis jiroveci are all except ?
questions.solution:
Pneumocystis can not be cultured

CD4 T cell less than 200 microlitre is a risk factor as well as an indication for chemoprophylaxis for P. Jivovecci

Cotrimoxazole is the DOC.

Reference: Textbook of clinical mycology 415

choices.text: In early stage it is indistinguishable from TB
Person to person spread occurs by droplet infection

questions.text: What is true about Histoplasmosis
questions.solution:
Caseation necrosis and calcification may mimic tuberculosis.

About other option

Culture is the preferred method for diagnoisis.

Spores are the infective form and infection is acquired by inhalation of spores

Histoplasma infection never transmits from man to man.

Reference: Textbook of clinical mycology 405

choices.text: Causes fulminant infections in immune compromised patients

questions.text: What is false about penicillium marefi
questions.solution:
The most distinguishing characteristic of mould phase ( at 25 degree celsius) of penicillium is the early presence of red pigment that diffuses into agar. The colonies start as pinkish-yellow and evolve into a bluish green color in the centre with a white periphery.

Reference: Textbook of clinical mycology 315

questions.text: A gardener has multiple vesicles on hand and multiple eruptions along the lymphatics. Most common fungus responsible is ?
questions.solution: Multiple vesicle on hand and multiple eruptions along the lymphatics in a gardner suggest the diagnosis sporotrichosis

choices.text: Is a chronic mycotic disease that typically involves skin, subcutaneous tissue and regional lymphatics
Most cases are acquired via cutaneous inoculation
Enlarged lymph nodes extending centripetally as a beaded chain are a characteristic finding
IT is an occupational disease of butchers, doctors

questions.text: A plant prick can produce sporotrichosis. All are true statements about sporotrichosis EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Sporotrichosis is caused by the thermally dimorphic fungus sporothrix schenckii

Because S schenckii naturally found in soil, hay, sphagnum moss and plants. It usually affect farmer, gardner, agricultural worker ( Not butcher, doctor)

This fungal disease usually affects the skin although rare form can affect the lungs joints bones and CNS

The fungus enters through small cuts and abrasions in the skin to cause the infection

Because roses can spread the disease, it is one of a few diseases referred to as rose thorn or rose gardner's disease.

questions.text: Zieman stippling of erythrocyte is caused by which species of plasmodium
questions.solution:
P vivax - Schuffner's dot

P falciparum - Maurer's dot

P malariae - Ziemnn's stippling

P ovale - Scjiffmer's dot

Reference: Chatterjee 12th 79-80

questions.text: Intermediate hosts for toxoplasma are all except
questions.solution:
Definative host for toxoplasma - cat

Intermediate host for toxoplasma - Human, mouse, sheep or pig

Reference: Chatterjee 12th 100

questions.text: Cysticercosis is cause by
questions.solution:
Tape worm

T solium - Larval stage - cysticercus cellulosae

  • Develops in the muscle of the pig
  • Has also been found in the man causing cysticercosis

T saginata - Larval stage - Cysticercus bovis

  • Develops in the muscle of a cow or buffalo
  • Not found in man

Reference: Chaterjee 12th 119

questions.text: Least common site of calcified hydatid cyst is
questions.solution:
Pulmonary hydatid cyst almost never calcify, unlike mediastinal cyst

Reference: Chatterjee 12th 167

questions.text: A man on return from a country complains of pain in abdomen, jaundice with increased alkaline phosphatise and conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. USG shows blockage in the biliary tree. What could be the cause
questions.solution:
Among the given options only clonorchis sinensis is a liver fluke which can cause hpatic dysfunction with jaundice and hyperbilirubinemia

questions.text: Lymphatic filariasis is caused by all except
questions.solution:
There are following types of filariasis

Lymphatic filariasis - wuchereria bancrofti, Brugia malayi, Brugia timori

Subcutaneous filariasis - Loa loa, Onchocercavolvulus, Mansonella streptocerca

Serous cavity filariasis - Mansonella ozzardi, Mansonella perstans
